intro: Rhexia pulcherrima, commonly known as the showy rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Rhexia pulcherrima is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
